intro: Trichilia havanensis var. spatulata, commonly known as the spatulate trichilia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often spatulate in shape, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and clustered in panicles, typically blooming during the rainy season. The tree produces woody capsules that contain several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems and traditional uses.
